intro: Primula mirabilis, commonly known as the wonder primrose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in shades of yellow, orange, and red, often with a distinctive dark center. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has a rosette of basal leaves that are oval and hairy. Its flowers bloom in early spring, and the plant thrives in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil. Primula mirabilis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
